content.description: On the left side of the Fun Bags boulder, start under the roof on a jug/undercling combo hold. Move out onto the face using slopey crimps before gaining a jug slot and easy juggy top out. This problem will be significantly harder if you are on the shorter side.
content.protection: Pads. Landing is mostly good, low crux.

content.description: Highball straight up middle of face with some fantastic holds.
content.location: Left of Point Setter, opposite Napoleon

content.description: Tall face in corridor left of arete.
content.location: Right of Fun Bags on the seam with jugs.

content.description: A bit of a one-move-wonder but fun nonetheless and popular due to its proximity to the classic Fun Bags. Sit start on the arete left of On Location, work up to a shallow left hand sidepull and either make a big move/jump to the lip or get scrunchy on the arete on poor holds. Top out gently on suspect looking rock that's good enough.
content.location: On the boulder north/west of Fun Bags, left of On Location.

content.description:
Stand start with a high right hand sidepull/undercling block, moving left into the slopers. From here, head up on slopey crimps to a juggy topout.

There is also an optional sit start on crimps down low and right of the stand start, which is incredibly awkward.
content.protection: Pads, spotters. The landing is mostly good.
content.location: This starts in the corridor between the boulders, moving left and climbing between the two boulders.

content.description: Climb up blunt overhanging arete with punchy moves on a mix of small sidepull- and downpull-crimps.
content.location: Right arete on sunny face of Bulldog boulder.

content.description: The shallow finger crack over a tiered and sloped landing.VARIATION: At half-height, move right using face holds to stay over a better landing zone.

This is the left-hand start to Fun Bags. Low/sit start next to boulder, go up to big edge then crux move out right to get the slopers of Fun Bags. Finish up that problem.Would be super classic if it wasn't for dabby/awkward start.You can skip dabby start by beginning at large edge as a stand. This makes it more like V7.
Sit start left side of crack, left hand crack, right hand slopey crimp on face. Traverse crack/seam around corner and then finish up Floozy or its right-hand variation.
On the boulder adjacent to Fun Bags. Start low on good holds and fire six feet up and right to a big horn. One of the area's classic dynos.
content.location: Right behind you if you were on Fun Bags.

content.description: A shady boulder with a slightly overhanging face with many slopey rails.
